tweet: The objective is to fill a 9×9 grid with digits so that each column, each row, and each of the nine 3×3 sub-grids that compose the grid
The puzzle setter provides a partially completed grid, which typically has a unique solution
Completed puzzles are always a type of Latin square with an additional constraint on the contents of individual regions
The puzzle was popularized in 1986 by the Japanese puzzle company Nikoli, under the name Sudoku, meaning single number
In the United States, the first newspaper to publish a Sudoku puzzle by Wayne Gould was The Conway Daily Sun (New Hampshire), in 2004
